root: ^My classmate has "borrowed" his father's car and invites me to have a ride. How should I react?
^Refuse cuz this is dangerous and illegal
^Accept the invitation and take the driver's seat
^Talk him out of it, and threaten to tell his father about it

res1: ^We got stopped by the first policeman we met and spent the rest of the day in a police station. Luckily, it wasn't me driving
^My classmate "borrowed" his father's car and invited me to have a ride. We got stopped by the first policeman we met and spent the rest of the day in a police station. Luckily, it wasn't me driving.
res2: ^He said I was a coward. He went on a ride anyway and crashed his father's car. What an idiot!
^My classmate "borrowed" his father's car and invited me to have a ride. I refused, and he said I was a coward. He went on a ride anyway and crashed his father's car. What an idiot!
res3: ^It was the hell of a ride! My classmate nearly pissed his pants, but everything ended well
^My classmate "borrowed" his father's car and invited me to have a ride. I took the driver's seat and gave us a great journey!
res4: ^He put the car back into the garage. We're not in a movie car chase, after all
^My classmate "borrowed" his father's car and invited me to have a ride. I threatened to tell his father about it, and he gave up his idea. We're not in a movie car chase, after all.
